title: Experience-Based Mathematical Problem-Solving Course for Developing Strategic Thinking Competencies

context.prior_knowledge: Basic arithmetic operation skills and experience solving job-related fundamental problems
context.additional_context: Strengthening strategic thinking training for solving workplace problems, experiential learning through mathematical modeling and simulation.

learning_goals: Learners can experience and evaluate strategic decision-making processes three or more times via math simulations based on real-world work scenarios.
Learners can perform recursive learning by analyzing failures and successes during problem-solving processes and revising strategies.
Through team-based collaboration simulations, learners can establish and mathematically validate optimal resource allocation strategies under competitive conditions.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
